posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Luck_Dragon wrote: I am sure that some feets / skill points can be rearranged for optimization. So any advice would be welcome.   
Luck Dragon, an assassin with AB 45 has to be taken seriously.
You achieve that very high AB with all the pre epic full BAB fighter levels and the epic bonus feats that let you reach G Dex VIII.
You need 13 fighter Levels to be able to x-class the stealth skills to 8 ranks and qualify for assassin. That also gives you an awful lot of pre-epic feats to spend. You spend them on feats for a ranged- and a melee weapon.
The down side of taking that many warrior class levels, is that assassin with the DA damage and paralyzation comes late, and to a lesser degree because of fewer assassin levels, and has to compete with the higher fort saves of near epic targets. The high intelligence compesates some and improves the DC.

If I should suggest improvements, I would replace some of the feats and rearrange the order in which they are taken.
You also ask for an opinion on the skills. I will give you my suggestion below.

As for feats, I think this character will benefit from IKD for better melee fighting and Rapid shot for better archery. It will also benefit from EWS in both weapons.
I don't think you need Called shot much. You use HIPS for crowd control, and are ready to use your rapier in close combat. Iron will is not going to save your abysmal will saves, so drop it. You already have to use potions of clarity extensively, or any other mind shielding equipment anyway. You can also live without Toughness when you have HIPS and Improved invisibility.
Dropping those three gives you room for KD, IKD and RS.
I suggest that you drop two G Dex feats to give room for the two EWS feats. You take EWF on level 21 and 24. That let you take both EWS with the fighter Level on 27.
You improve weapon damage by 4 at the cost of 1 AB. (44 AB is still very good in a HIPSing assassin build). The extra weapon damage can come in handy vs sneak immunes, since this is a dex build.

I would take the feats in this order for better playability:
Spoiler 01: Fighter(1): Weapon Finesse, Point Blank Shot 03: Fighter(3): Weapon Focus: Longbow 05: Fighter(5) 07: Fighter(7) 09: Fighter(9): Rapid Shot 11: Fighter(11) 13: Fighter(13) 15: Assassin(2): Dodge, {Uncanny Dodge I} 17: Assassin(4) 19: Assassin(6) 21: Shadowdancer(1): Epic Weapon Focus: Rapier, {Hide in Plain Sight} 23: Assassin(9) 25: Assassin(11) 27: Fighter(14): Epic Weapon Specialization: Rapier, Epic Weapon Specialization: Longbow 29: Assassin(14): Great Dexterity I, (DEX=26) 31: Assassin(16) 33: Assassin(18): Great Dexterity II, Great Dexterity III, (DEX=29) 35: Assassin(20) 37: Assassin(22): Great Dexterity V, (DEX=32) 39: Assassin(24): Great Dexterity VI, (DEX=33)
My suggested skill list is:
Disable Trap 1(4), Hide 43(55), Move Silently 43(55), Open Lock 30(42), Search 16(21), Set Trap 1(13), Spot (or Listen) 43(44), Tumble 40(52), UMD 36(35)

Edit: The bonus to saves vs poison is actually +12. There is a bug in the old CBC sheets that stops it at +6.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
If I may also suggest something, it'd be to drop 3 Assassin levels for 2 Fighter and 1 SD. You lose 2d6 damage and 3 DA DC, but gain Evasion and an extra Bonus Feat from Fighter 16. That'll allow you to rearrange some feats and get EWS in both weapons, but you'd still need to drop 1 feat. So, here's the options:

Keep the 2 Great Dexterities and drop Epic Prowess (gaining 1 AC) compared to Mick's suggestion;

OR

Drop both Great Dexterities, keep Epic Prowess and add Armor Skin to the mix (still gaining 1 AC compared to Mick's suggestion)

OR

If you're unwilling to relinquish any AB points, you can still use that Fighter feat to get EWS in your melee weapon, ensuring that much needed damage against sneak-immune foes.

So, by dropping Assassin down to 22, you have many options. For my playstyle, Evasion alone (at level 22 with SD2) is worth the trade. The tradeoff is -2d6 DA damage +(-3 DA DC) for Evasion + EWS in one weapon (or -1 AB and EWS in both weapons).

For me, that's worth it. Especially considering what Mick pointed out about you having to leave the Assassin levels all for Epics, which means you'll mostly be facing high Fort saves for most of your life with a mediocre DC to your DA, which would only become somewhat competitive by the mid-30s.

Take it EZ!
